angry.description: Released in 1913, 'The Rite of Spring' by Igor Stravinsky is known for its raw energy and innovative orchestration. The piece, with its intense rhythms and dissonance, evokes a sense of primal anger and upheaval.
angry.name: The Rite of Spring

chill.description: Bach's 'Goldberg Variations,' composed in 1741, is a monumental work for harpsichord. With its intricate variations and serene character, this piece offers a deeply reflective and calming listening experience.
chill.name: Goldberg Variations

happy.description: Beethoven's 'Symphony No. 7,' composed between 1811 and 1812, is renowned for its rhythmic vitality and joyful spirit. The symphony's exuberant character makes it a perfect choice for a happy mood.
happy.name: Symphony No. 7

love.description: Chopin's 'Nocturnes,' composed between 1830 and 1846, are renowned for their lyrical and romantic qualities. These pieces evoke a deep sense of intimacy and love through their expressive melodies and harmonies.
love.name: Nocturnes

sad.description: Mahler's 'Symphony No. 5,' composed between 1901 and 1902, is known for its profound emotional depth. The Adagio movement, in particular, is a deeply moving exploration of sorrow and reflection.
sad.name: Symphony No. 5
